intro: Cucubalus otites, commonly known as the African star apple, is a tropical shrub native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces a large, spiny fruit that contains a single, large, edible seed surrounded by a fleshy, sweet pulp. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in local medicine.
